It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the University of Memphis Libraries, 126 Ned R. McWherter Library, The University of Memphis, Memphis, TN 38152-6500.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1832 Aug. 25 [to] John Coffee Jr. / Andrew Jackson
bibl.author: Jackson, Andrew
bibl.note: This document is a letter dated August 25, 1832 to John Coffee Jr. from Andrew Jackson requesting that Coffee pick up his watch from a repair shop and return it to him.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Note from Uncle Jackson to get his watch.
div.p: Mr. John Coffee Jr. will please to see Mr. E. Foster to whom I handed my watch to be placed in the hands of the best artist for repair, know in whose hand it was placed, apply for her, and if done receive her, with the bill for repairs, hand the bill to Mr. Josiah Nichol, who will pay it and send me the watch by the first safe opportunity and oblige yr your affectionate uncle
